text: <@U4VR52RQE> has renamed the channel from "z-shared-20" to "zubair-and-iram"
name: zubair-and-iram

text:
<!channel> Iram please meet Zubair your incredible E-Mentor I've been telling you about :smile:.  Feel free to introduce yourselves, say a little bit about what you would like to get out of the relationship and continue chatting within this channel. :wave:

I will now be leaving the channel, but please direct message myself or emma-prospela if you have any questions. All the best for now! :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi, I am Iram,
I am currently studying 3 A levels in English literature, Mathematics and Biology. I plan to gain an accounting apprenticeship after Y13.

My future goals is to complete all ACCA exams and become an ACCA member.

I wish to ask you many questions, however I would like to kickstart this conversation by asking you how you secured YOUR apprenticeship.

Could you share your experiences on the procedure of applying for an apprenticeship and give me some guidance as to what I would need to do to secure one myself in the field of accounts?

Hi Iram. Glad to speak to you. 
I first started off by applying on loads of different job websites and just getting a feel of the questions jobs were requiring in terms of competence. Bare in mind, some companies don’t advertise through there, just on their own website. so if you like a particular company , it would be worthwhile going on their website directly. 
Anyways, if I was invited to a interview, I knew I had a decent answer and use that as my template. Then tailor and improve the answers for each different application. 

I initially found this apprenticeship on Next website, but it got taken off and thus, I searched for it on LinkedIn and their it appeared. I had actually applied for this role once already a few months prior which didn’t bring back an answer, so I re-did my application on the second time and managed to get through.

Youve probably heard this before. But you need to show willingness that you want to go into accounting. Maybe it’s something you e done at home or in college etc. 
My father was a accountant. So I had a family background of it.  And in my computing class In college, I used aspects of accounting (Tax) in my final project.
